page.title: 01THE SMEATHARPE AREA
page.content: Smeatharpe (formerly Smith's Harp) is right on the Devon/Somerset border. It is situated on a plateau stretching several square kilometres, which is on average 25O metres above sea level. It is a rural area and the village is surrounded by farmland. Smeatharpe is a sprawling village which has a secondary road from Honiton to Taunton running through it. There is a Village Hall, public telephone box, postbox, and approximately 32 houses with a population of about 9O people. About half a kilometre away lies Newhouse, which comprises the Baptist Church, Church Hall, manse and two other cottages. Adjacent to Smeatharpe is a disused wartime aerodrome which was sited here because of the high altitude.
